summary: Apple exec said they saw search queries decline for the first time in April . Bears jumped on this news to claim that search was a dying business . There are a number of reasons to believe the Alphabet and Google search will be just fine moving forward .  $20 billion is the amount of revenue-sharing money that Apple receives from Alphabet each year for Google to be the exclusive search engine for its Safari browser . The revenue is pure margin and accounts for more than 15% of Apple's operating income .  Apple has 20 billion reasons why it would want to depict search as becoming increasingly irrelevant . Alphabet refuted Apple's claims about its search queries declining in a blog post . It said it continued to see overall search query growth, including on Apple devices and platforms .  AI chatbots are likely to eventually have a much different monetization model than search . The cost of answering AI queries is exponentially higher than providing search results . Google isn't making money from historical or curiosity-driven questions with no commercial relevance .  Paid tiers with some advertising support are likely the future model of the AI chatbot industry . However, this is likely to make AI chatbots more complementary than replace search . Google has a huge two-sided ad network that can connect advertisers to global, national, regional, or local audiences .  Search ad prices are likely to rise as advertisers will still need effective ways to reach consumers . With fewer high-traffic platforms available, advertisers will be willing to pay a premium to access that limited supply . The company is looking to use Gemini to enhance Google search with AI . Uber's stock has climbed 37% since January and is up 22% from a year ago .  Khosrowshahi: "Consumers are loving the product. The team on the ground is doing a terrific job in terms of repairs and cleaning and recharging the cars, etc., to make sure that the Waymos are available for rides" "Obviously, Waymo has a safety track record second to none," he said . "We’re super excited for expansion in Atlanta as well as some of the other [autonomous vehicle] announcements"  Khosrowshahi: "10 years from now every single new car sold comes with Level 4, Level 5 AV" Uber recently told employees to come to the office three days a week, up from two . WeRide, Waymo and Toyota recently unveiled a collaboration on autonomous-driving technology .  Wedbush downgraded Uber to neutral from outperform with a price target of $85, up from $80 . The company reported "mixed" first-quarter results with "healthy guidance" for Q2, Wedbush said .  Citi raised its price target on Uber to $102 from $92 and affirmed a buy rating on the shares following the Q1 report . Quantum computing is emerging as a new, exciting pocket of the broader AI realm -- estimated to be worth hundreds of billions in the coming decades . Over the last several months, companies such as IonQ, Rigetti Computing, Alphabet, Microsoft, and many more have come into the spotlight thanks to their roles in the quantum computing space .  McKinsey & Company estimates the total addressable market for quantum computing could be $131 billion by 2040 . McKinsey sees mobility, life sciences, chemicals, and financial services as four of the biggest opportunities -- set to potentially gain $1.3 trillion in value .  Interest in quantum computing started to emerge in the later months of 2024 . IonQ, Rigetti Computing, Quantum Computing, and D-Wave Quantum aren't generating much in terms of revenue . Despite their precipitous sell-offs, each of the stocks in this peer set still trades for extended valuations .  Each company is trading at a valuation near or more than $1 billion . None of these companies is on a proven path to generate consistent profitability . Nvidia is building an end-to-end platform for enterprise AI .  Nvidia is parlaying this strategy by adding another stitch to the broader CUDA fabric . As of this writing (May 7), Nvidia stock has plummeted 24% off its 12-month high . I think the company is going to emerge as a force in the quantum computing industry despite receiving little coverage in the space .  Investors should consider taking advantage of Nvidia's current depressed price action and buy the stock hand over fist . For now, Nvidia remains in control of the AI chip market, and quantum computing represents a longer-term opportunity worth tens of billions of dollars for the company .  Right now, we’re issuing “Double Down” alerts for three incredible companies, available when you joinStock Advisor, and there may not be another chance like this anytime soon . Ark Invest has recently started adding to its position in Advanced Micro Devices . This could be a smart move as AMD's data center business is still in its early phases . Forward valuation estimates suggest that AMD stock could be oversold .  AMD has quietly built a respectabledata data center business of its own . Nvidia is widely seen as the undeniable market leader in semiconductors and data centers . AMD's data center revenue and operating income from the data center segment have been solidified in recent years .  AMD's data center business is accelerating sales while widening its operating margins . Last year, Nvidia generated upwards of $115 billion in revenue just from the data-center business . The next few years are going to be quite interesting in the chip space .  Year to date, shares of AMD have plummeted by some 37% . Nvidia will likely continue to be a critical player in the AI infrastructure space for the long run . AMD is already working with Meta Platforms, Microsoft, andOracle in data center space .  AMD stock trades at a modest forward price-to-earnings (P/E) multiple of just 22.4 . AMD may never become as large as Nvidia, and that is OK . The bigger idea is whether or not AMD can scale its current GPU business and do so in a profitable way . AppLovin (APP) is making a name for itself in mobile advertising . The tech company recently announced its intention to sell its less profitable and declining mobile gaming business for $400 million in cash .  AppLovin’s AXON platform marks an evolution from its mobile gaming origins, leveraging AI to deliver real-time data analysis and highly efficient ad targeting . The confluence of factors makes me cautiously bullish on APP stock .  AppLovin's stellar numbers have propelled it into the ranks of leading tech players, now boasting a market cap in excess of $100 billion . The stock trades at a P/E ratio of 67 — nearly three times the sector median — signaling that investors are pricing in near-flawless execution and continued strong performance .  APP is a Moderate Buy based on 15 Buy, three Hold, and one Sell rating in the past three months . AppLovin must navigate scrutiny over data collection and compliance with platform policies . The average price target of $473.06implies 40% upside over the next twelve months .  AppLovin’s AXON platform has elevated the company to a leadership position in AI-driven mobile advertising . Strong revenue growth and exceptional adjusted EBITDA margins showcase its powerful operating leverage . The advertising landscape remains highly competitive and unpredictable, making future outcomes hard to call .  This article includes a disclaimer . AI upstart OpenAI abandoned plans to convert itself into a for-profit enterprise . The company also appointed Instacart CEOFidji Simoas its new head of applications . It also reached an agreement to purchase AI coding tool Windsurf for $3 billion . Elon Musk is still fighting a legal battle against the company .  OpenAI had hoped to shed its nonprofit status to attract additional investors . Instead, the company will turn its for-profit arm into a public benefit corporation . The new PBC will not be constricted by profit caps that currently limit profits for outside investors .  Musk argues that OpenAI's new for-profit venture is a "facade" and a "PR announcement" meant to obscure company executives' looting and profiteering off the nonprofit . Musk claims his former partner in charity, OpenAI co-founder Sam Altman, scrapped the business plan to hide misappropriated donations .  OpenAI has removed all previous profit caps on outside investment, and that the tens of billions of dollars in investment expressly conditioned on its for-profit conversion will now vest..." Microsoft invested $13.75 billion in OpenAI's for-profits arm, dCeline's .  Simo was already serving on OpenAI's board before the announcement . Altman said he moved up due to a leak . Simo will have to ensure that OpenAI continues to evolve its offerings at a regular cadence .  Generative AI is still relatively new, and there's no telling which companies will stick around and which will fall to the wayside . Despite OpenAI's early mover status, the generative AI field is still wide open .

Uber Technologies (UBER) stock is on a tear without brakes in sight . Robust growth in ridesharing and delivery, plus game-changing autonomous vehicle partnerships, keep Uber’s engine purring . Gross bookings grew 14% year-over-year to $42.8 billion, or 18% on a constant currency basis .  CEO Dara Khosrowshahi credited stronger user retention and “rapid innovation” in both the Mobility and Delivery segments . Uber One membership program ballooned to 30 million members, up 60% year-over-year . Management’s doubling down on new offerings like airport shuttles and rider verification to boost safety .  Uber’s bottom-line metrics were even more praiseworthy, withadjusted EBITDA soaring 35% to $1.9 billion . Free cash flow was the absolute stunner at $2.3 billion . Stock-based compensation (SBC) as a percentage of revenue dropped to 4.4% over the past year .  Despite stellar earnings report, Uber’s stock has actually dipped post-earnings . This is not a revenue growth story (although revenue growth was strong) but a free cash flow growth story . Uber is starting to print cash, which will only intensify as it gradually hits higher scalability .  Uber's snowballing free cash flow could power heftier buybacks in the long run . Despite Wall Street’s not-so-positive post-earnings reaction, analysts are still very bullish on UBER stock . Over the past three months, UBER has gathered 25 Buy and three Hold ratings, forming a Strong Buy consensus on Wall Street .  $100 is the natural psychological price target that’s next for UBER bulls . With robotaxis revving and global growth humming, I’m betting $100 .

Around 170 million people use Uber's ride-hailing, food delivery, and commercial freight services every month . Uber's CEO thinks autonomous mobility is a $1 trillion opportunity in the U.S. alone . Uber has signed partnerships with 18 companies that develop autonomous cars, robots, and even aircraft .  During the first quarter of 2025, Uber reported $42.8 billion in gross bookings . After deducting a further $12.9 billion in merchant payouts, Uber was left with $11.5 billion in revenue . Once factored in operating costs like marketing and research and development, its net income(profit) for the quarter came in at $1.7 billion .  If self-driving cars and robots reduce Uber's reliance on human drivers, the company could pocket an additional $18.6 billion from its gross bookings each quarter . Uber has partnerships with 18 different providers of autonomous vehicles, up from 14 just six months earlier .  Uber is facilitating around 1.5 million autonomous trips per year . Many of those are attributable to Waymo, which is completing 250,000 paid autonomous trips a week . Waymo has been operating in Phoenix, Los Angeles, and San Francisco, but it entered Austin, Texas, in March .  Uber wants to help its autonomous partners commercialize their technologies more quickly . Autonomous vehicles have potential to save the company money on human drivers . Uber will use Nvidia's DGX Cloud supercomputer platform to process data from the billions of trips it facilitates .  Uber will need to generate $226.5 billion in annual revenue by 2035 to justify a fivefold return in its stock . That translates to a compound annual growth rate of 17.5% over the next decade . Between 2017 and 2024, Uber actually grew its revenue at a much faster annual rate of 27.7% .  The company's revenue growthaverages17.5% over the next 10 years, it will lay the foundation for a fivefold return in its stock . Self-driving cars could be a huge tailwind for Uber in the U.S. toward autonomous vehicles . Cathie Wood thinks Tesla's share price could skyrocket 9x by 2029, with robotaxis generating 90% of its earnings . Tesla faces competition in the robotaxi market, as well as challenges with its existing business .  Ark Invest estimates that close to 90% of Tesla's earnings will stem from autonomous ride-hailing services (robotaxis) within the next four years . Wood expects Tesla will own and operate its own robotaxi fleet, at least at first . Over time, she anticipates that third-party companies will run the vehicle networks .  Tesla CEO Elon Musk expects robotaxis to be rolled out in Austin in June . Waymo already operates robotaxis in Austin, Los Angeles, Phoenix, and San Francisco . Uber is partnering with Waymo and May Mobility to roll out autonomous ride-hailing in Atlanta .  Tesla missed analysts' top- and bottom-line estimates in Q1 . Musk argued in the Q1 earnings call that Waymo's cars are much more expensive and manufactured in low volumes . Musk believes that Tesla's business should be resilient to tariffs to some extent because of its focus on North American manufacturing .  Tesla CEO: "We have a lot of things underway to increase the localization, to reduce supply chain risk associated with geopolitical uncertainty" Wood is on the same page. We'll probably soon find out if she's right .  There may not be another chance like this anytime soon . Tesla and Uber Technologies are among the top three stocks in the U.S. market .

Language-learning app Duolingo announced plans this week to replace contractors with AI and become an ‘AI-first” company . In advanced economies, about 60 percent of jobs may be impacted by AI in advanced economies .  Most AI-related layoffs so far have hit white-collar or tech jobs that are only a portion of the workforce . Many companies are restructuring workflows rather than eliminating full positions . Many laid-off workers are finding new roles in companies adopting AI but needing people to manage, prompt, or train the systems .
